mod-organizer.name: Mod Organizer
mod-organizer.description: Main tool similar to the Nexus Mod Manager (NMM) but much more advanced

boss.name: Better Oblivion Sorting Software
boss.description: Sorting the mods automatically from a masterlist
boss.note: install and then add as an executable in MO

bum.name: BOSS Userlist Manager
bum.description: The BOSS Userlist Manager helps you position your unrecognised mods in your load order so you only need to do this once.
bum.note: install and then add as an executable in MO

conskrybe.name: ConSkrybe
conskrybe.description: All messages, including those that you type into the console, are logged to the plugin's debug log found in the root game directory.

ddsopt.name: DDSopt
ddsopt.description: DDSopt is a tool which manages (preview & resizes) and recompresses your DDS-files.
ddsopt.note: see step-project for more information: http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:DDSopt

optimizer-textures.name: Optimizer Textures
optimizer-textures.description: Textures Check, Fix, Compress, Improves Perfomace. Extra: Optimizer BSA.

skyrim-performance-monitor.name: Skyrim Performance Monitor
skyrim-performance-monitor.description: The Skyrim Performance Monitor is a utility used for tracking Skyrimâ€™s system resource usage as it relates to INI settings and installed mods.
skyrim-performance-monitor.note: Run the two installer programs: "SlimDX Runtime .NET 2.0 (January 2012).msi" and "Setup.msi"

tes5edit.name: TES5Edit
tes5edit.description: TES5Edit is an advanced tool for manipulating Skyrim plugins.
tes5edit.note: install and then add as an executable in MO

wrye-bash.name: Wrye Bash
wrye-bash.description: Makes it safe to try out new mods because it will restore everything to the way it was when you uninstall a mod. Makes more mods compatible with each other by importing information from different mods into a "bashed patch"
wrye-bash.note: install and then add as an executable in MO
